Articles.Content:
Uh, whats a plaid?

also, HYYYYYYP-ERSPEED

> 
> Uh, whats a plaid?
> also, HYYYYYYP-ERSPEED

Plaid is as defined by Gregox: when you are moving parallel to the planes of space. It is one step up from ludicrous, two steps from ridiculous, 3 steps from Hyperspeed, and 4 steps from light speed.

Hyperspeed!

![Hypersapce_advanced_tel](http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20111030082128/stargate/images/9/96/Hypersapce_advanced_tel)
Thank ya!

OF course i've got finals coming

![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Well, I guess i'll have to manage my time wisely. no sleep
Not a problem- always willing to help a fellow hyper!

> 
> OF course i've got finals coming
> ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> Well, I guess i'll have to manage my time wisely. no sleep

Sleep

> Sleep

I choose KSP

(I can maintain at least a B+ and live off of 5 Hour Energies)
Hey, only three more posts until the 1337 post!

> 
> Hey, only three more posts until the 1337 post!

Imagining people furiously pressing f5.
Its an insane game of chicken, and with this. I HEREBY START THE 32ND HYPEUAL THREAD WAR FOR POST NUMBER 1337!!!!

Welcome to the l33t post! Sit down and sweg a while!

So, I hear that there's a new player in the new server called xXAeroDyNoMiteNamicsXx is noscoping all the nukes.

> 
> I have 1337

Victory, Kenbob5588

Flawless victory!

> 
> Fairings don't look amazing, but I really don't care. THERE IS SOO MucH GOOD STUFF.
> Also, nothing like some kessler syndrome in Kerbal Space Program.

Actually as the fairings aren't real parts once they disconnect, they truly are nothing like Kessler Syndrome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Hey, 5th horseman, i wonder if you flying potato will still fly.

> 
> Actually as the fairings aren't real parts once they disconnect, they truly are nothing like Kessler Syndrome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

But I want me some Kessler!
It looks like TheWinterOwl's vid is a version that doesn't have the new in-line 1.25m cockpit.

> 
> Hey, 5th horseman, i wonder if you flying potato will still fly.

Based on tetryds' thread, I think it would, but I doubt I could do it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T00:07:42Z" title="04/26/2015 12:07  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by 5thHorseman**

Changes of Hypening!

[https://steamdb.info/app/220200/history/](https://steamdb.info/app/220200/history/)

> 
> It looks like TheWinterOwl's vid is a version that doesn't have the new in-line 1.25m cockpit.

His tech tree was also looking also a bit different from Scotts. But I did like how he took things slowly and took time to explain and show off. The guys at KSPTV are just going LOLImplaying1.0 IhavenoideawhatIamdoing

> 
> It looks like TheWinterOwl's vid is a version that doesn't have the new in-line 1.25m cockpit.

I noticed that earlier.
Oh my god, I just noticed from the cinematic trailer: launchpad smoke isn't just on the launchpad, it's everywhere! This is amazing! Actual launch effects!
![Q6Ce3Ky.gif](http://i.imgur.com/Q6Ce3Ky.gif)
Hype at everything, except the fact that we are so constrained by the lack of choice with fairings. They have to come apart like confetti, and only in two halves.

No, we better not overloadÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ I'll really spill my drink then!

And I'm sorry, but I really can't see how the lack of clamshelling fairings is a big deal. Maybe Werner is on to something, maybe the potato chip fairings are actually a much better way of doing things.

Does it really really really matter???
